AA.name: Party to be billed (AAR Accounting rule 11)
AA.desc: Party to be billed in accordance with AAR Accounting rule 11.

AB.name: Buyer's agent/representative
AB.desc: Third party who arranged the purchase of merchandise on behalf of the actual buyer.

AE.name: Declarant's agent/representative
AE.desc: Any natural or legal person who makes a declaration to an official body on behalf of another natural or legal person, where legally permitted (CCC).

AF.name: Transit principal
AF.desc: Natural or legal person responsible for the satisfactory performance of a Customs transit operation. Source: CCC.

AG.name: Agent/representative
AG.desc: (3196) Party authorized to act on behalf of another party.

AH.name: Transit principal's agent/representative
AH.desc: Agent acting on behalf of the transit principal (CCC).

AI.name: Successful job applicant
AI.desc: Person who has been chosen for a job.

AK.name: Acknowledgement recipient
AK.desc: Party to whom acknowledgement should be sent.

AL.name: Principal
AL.desc: (3340) Party accepting liability for goods held or moving (e.g. transit) under a Customs authorization and - when applicable - a guarantee.

AM.name: Authorized official
AM.desc: Employee of a company or firm authorized to act on behalf of that company or firm e.g. to make a Customs declaration.

AN.name: Approved importer
AN.desc: Person or company which is authorised by the relevant Customs authority to import goods without payment all taxes or specific taxes at the point of entry into the country.

AP.name: Accepting party
AP.desc: (3352) Party accepting goods, products, services etc.

AQ.name: Approved consignor
AQ.desc: Person or company approved by the relevant authority in the country to pack and export specific goods under Customs supervision.

AR.name: Authorized exporter
AR.desc: Exporter authorized/approved by Customs for special Customs procedures e.g. simplified procedure.

AT.name: Authorized importer
AT.desc: Importer authorized/approved by Customs for special Customs procedures e.g. simplified procedure.

AU.name: Authorized trader (transit)
AU.desc: Trader authorized/approved by Customs for special transit procedures e.g. simplified procedure.

AV.name: Authorizing official
AV.desc: Party that has delegated the authority to take a certain action on behalf of a company or agency.

AW.name: Applicant's bank
AW.desc: Financial institution which is requested to issue the documentary credit.

AX.name: Authenticating party
AX.desc: Party which certifies that a document is authentic.

AZ.name: Issuing bank
AZ.desc: Financial institution which issues the documentary credit, if the applicant's bank is not acting as the issuing bank.

B1.name: Contact bank 1
B1.desc: Identifies an additional bank which must be informed of certain aspects of the message.

B2.name: Contact bank 2
B2.desc: Identifies an additional bank which must be informed of certain aspects of the message.

BA.name: Booking agent
BA.desc: Party acting as a booking office for transport and forwarding services.

BB.name: Buyer's bank
BB.desc: [3420] Bank employed by the buyer to make payment.

BC.name: Negotiating bank
BC.desc: Financial institution to whom a negotiable documentary credit is directed.

BE.name: Beneficiary
BE.desc: The ultimate recipient of the funds. Normally the account owner who is reimbursed by the payor.

BF.name: Beneficiary's bank
BF.desc: Identifies the account servicer for the beneficiary or the payee.

BI.name: Buyer's financial institution
BI.desc: Financial institution designated by buyer to make payment.

BM.name: Insured
BM.desc: Party which is the object of an insurance contract.

BN.name: Insurance beneficiary
BN.desc: Party which benefits from insurance coverage.

BO.name: Broker or sales office
BO.desc: Party acting in the name of the seller as broker or as sales office.

BP.name: Building site purchaser
BP.desc: Party at the building site responsible for the purchasing of goods and services for that particular site.

BQ.name: Cheque drawn bank
BQ.desc: Identifies the bank on which the cheque should be drawn, as instructed by the ordering customer.

BS.name: Bill and ship to
BS.desc: Party receiving goods and relevant invoice.

BT.name: Party to be billed for other than freight (bill to)
BT.desc: Party receiving invoice excluding freight costs.

BU.name: Service bureau
BU.desc: Party carrying out service bureau processing work, (e.g. a payroll bureau).

BV.name: Member
BV.desc: Member of a group (e.g. of a group of persons or a service scheme).

BX.name: Building site engineer
BX.desc: Party at the building site responsible for engineering matters for that particular site.

BY.name: Buyer
BY.desc: (3002) Party to which merchandise is sold.

BZ.name: Building site forwarder
BZ.desc: Party at the building site responsible for forwarding the received goods on that particular site.

CA.name: Carrier
CA.desc: (3126) Party undertaking or arranging transport of goods between named points.

CB.name: Customs broker
CB.desc: Agent or representative or a professional Customs clearing agent who deals directly with Customs on behalf of the importer or exporter (CCC).

CC.name: Claimant
CC.desc: Party who claims goods or insurance.

CF.name: Container operator/lessee
CF.desc: Party to whom the possession of specified property (e.g. container) has been conveyed for a period of time in return for rental payments.

CG.name: Carrier's agent
CG.desc: Party authorized to act for or on behalf of carrier.

CH.name: Connecting carrier
CH.desc: Owner or operator of a transportation conveyance to which goods in a given transaction will be transferred.

CI.name: Commission processor
CI.desc: Party who provides extra treatment to goods on commission base.

CJ.name: Previous member
CJ.desc: Previous member of a group of persons or a service scheme.

CK.name: Empty equipment despatch party
CK.desc: Party from whose premises empty equipment will be or has been despatched.

CL.name: Container location party
CL.desc: Party from whose premises container will be or has been despatched.

CM.name: Customs
CM.desc: Identification of customs authority relevant to the transaction or shipment.

CN.name: Consignee
CN.desc: (3132) Party to which goods are consigned.

CO.name: Corporate office
CO.desc: Identification of the Head Office within a company.

COP.name: Convoying party
COP.desc: Party designated to escort the transported goods.

CP.name: Party to receive certificate of compliance
CP.desc: Party acting for or on behalf of seller in matters concerning compliance.

CPD.name: Charges payer at destination
CPD.desc: Party, other than the ordering party, which has to pay the charges concerning the destination operations.

CQ.name: Cheque order
CQ.desc: Party to which the cheque will be ordered, when different from the beneficiary.

CR.name: Empty equipment return party
CR.desc: Party to whose premises empty equipment will be or has been returned.

CS.name: Consolidator
CS.desc: Party consolidating various consignments, payments etc.

CX.name: Consignee's agent
CX.desc: Party authorized to act on behalf of the consignee.

CY.name: Commissionable agent
CY.desc: IATA cargo agent entitled to commission.

CZ.name: Consignor
CZ.desc: (3336) Party which, by contract with a carrier, consigns or sends goods with the carrier, or has them conveyed by him. Synonym: shipper, sender.

DA.name: Available with bank (documentary credits)
DA.desc: Financial institution with whom the documentary credit is available.

DB.name: Distributor branch
DB.desc: The affiliate of a retailer or distributor.

DC.name: Deconsolidator
DC.desc: Party that splits up a large consignment composed of separate consignments of goods. The smaller consignments of goods were grouped together into that large consignment for carriage as a larger unit in order to obtain a reduced rate.

DCP.name: Despatch charge payer
DCP.desc: Party, other than the ordering party, which has to pay the charges concerning the despatch operations.

DD.name: Documentary credit account party's bank
DD.desc: Bank of the documentary credit account party.

DE.name: Depositor
DE.desc: Party depositing goods, financial payments or documents.

DF.name: Documentary credit applicant
DF.desc: Party at whose request the applicant's bank/issuing bank is to issue a documentary credit.

DG.name: Documentary credit beneficiary
DG.desc: Party in whose favour the documentary credit is to be issued and the party that must comply with the credit's terms and conditions.

DH.name: Documentary credit account party
DH.desc: Party which is responsible for the payment settlement of the documentary credit with the applicant's bank/issuing bank, if different from the documentary credit applicant.

DI.name: Documentary credit second beneficiary
DI.desc: Party to whom the documentary credit can be transferred.

DJ.name: Party according to documentary credit transaction
DJ.desc: Party related to documentary credit transaction.

DK.name: Documentary credit beneficiary's bank
DK.desc: Financial institution with which the beneficiary of the documentary credit maintains an account.

DL.name: Factor
DL.desc: Company offering a financial service whereby a firm sells or transfers title to its accounts receivable to the factoring company.

DM.name: Party to whom documents are to be presented

DO.name: Document recipient
DO.desc: (1370) Party which should receive a specified document.

DP.name: Delivery party
DP.desc: (3144) Party to which goods should be delivered, if not identical with consignee.

DQ.name: Owner's agent
DQ.desc: Person acting on delegation of powers of the owner.

DR.name: Driver
DR.desc: Person who drives a means of transport.

DS.name: Distributor
DS.desc: Party distributing goods, financial payments or documents.

DT.name: Declarant
DT.desc: (3140) Party who makes a declaration to an official body or - where legally permitted - in whose name, or on whose behalf, a declaration to an official body is made.

DU.name: Owner's representative
DU.desc: Person commissioned by the owner to represent him in certain circumstances.

DV.name: Project management office
DV.desc: Party commissioned by the owner to follow through the execution of all works.

DW.name: Drawee
DW.desc: Party on whom drafts must be drawn.

DX.name: Engineer (construction)
DX.desc: Party representing the contractor to advise and supervise engineering aspects of the works.

DY.name: Engineer, resident (construction)
DY.desc: Party commissioned by the owner to advise and supervise engineering aspects of the works.

EB.name: Building inspectorate
EB.desc: Party controlling the conformity of works to legal and regulation rules.

EE.name: Location of goods for customs examination before clearance

EF.name: Project coordination office
EF.desc: Party responsible for technical coordination of works.

EI.name: Controller, quality
EI.desc: Party controlling the quality of goods and workmanship for the project.

EJ.name: Surveyor, quantity
EJ.desc: Party responsible for the quantification and valuation of the works on behalf of the contractor.

EK.name: Surveyor (professional), quantity
EK.desc: Party responsible to the owner for the quantification and valuation of the works.

EL.name: Project
EL.desc: Party responsible for a project, e.g. a construction project.

EM.name: Party to receive electronic memo of invoice
EM.desc: Party being informed about invoice issue (via EDI).

EN.name: Tenderer
EN.desc: Firm answering an invitation to tender.

EQ.name: Empty container responsible party
EQ.desc: Party responsible for the empty container.

ER.name: Empty container return agent
ER.desc: Party, designated by owner of containers, responsible for their collection as agreed between the owner and customer/ consignee.

ES.name: Contractor, lead
ES.desc: Leader representing a grouping of co-contractors.

ET.name: Co-contractor
ET.desc: Member of a grouping of co-contractors.

EU.name: Contractor, general
EU.desc: Single contractor for the whole construction project, working by his own or with subcontractors.

EV.name: Subcontractor
EV.desc: Firm carrying out a part of the works for a contractor.

EX.name: Exporter
EX.desc: (3030) Party who makes - or on whose behalf a Customs clearing agent or other authorized person makes - an export declaration. This may include a manufacturer, seller or other person. Within a Customs union, consignor may have the same meaning as exporter.

EY.name: Subcontractor, nominated
EY.desc: Subcontractor authorized by the owner after having been proposed.

EZ.name: Operator, essential services
EZ.desc: Operator of essential services e.g. water, sewerage system, power.

FB.name: Nominated freight company
FB.desc: Party nominated to act as transport company or carrier for the goods.

FC.name: Contractor, main
FC.desc: Firm or grouping of co-contractors which has been awarded the contract.

FF.name: Factor, correspondent
FF.desc: Factoring company engaged by another factoring company to assist the letter with the services provided to the clients (sellers).

FG.name: Buyer as officially registered
FG.desc: Buying party as officially registered with government.

FH.name: Seller as officially registered
FH.desc: Selling party as officially registered with government.

FK.name: Previous Trade Union
FK.desc: Employee organisation who previously represented an employee .

FL.name: Passenger
FL.desc: A person conveyed by a means of transport, other than the crew.

FM.name: Crew member
FM.desc: A person manning a means of transport.

FN.name: Tariff issuer
FN.desc: The issuer of a tariff, e.g. a freight tariff.

FP.name: Freight/charges payer
FP.desc: Party responsible for the payment of freight.

FR.name: Message from
FR.desc: Party where the message comes from.

FT.name: Party responsible for financial settlement
FT.desc: (3450) Party responsible for either the transfer or repatriation of the funds relating to a transaction.

FX.name: Current receiver
FX.desc: Current receiver of the goods in a multi-step transportation process (indirect flow) involving at least one grouping centre.

FY.name: Current sender
FY.desc: Current sender of the goods in a multi-step transportation process (indirect flow) involving at least one grouping centre.

FZ.name: Grouping centre
FZ.desc: A party in charge of groupage, including degroupage and regroupage.

GB.name: Chamber of commerce
GB.desc: Name of the Chamber of Commerce of the town where the company is registered.

GC.name: Goods custodian
GC.desc: (3024) Party responsible for the keeping of goods.

GD.name: Producer
GD.desc: Party or person who has produced the produce.

GE.name: Registration tribunal
GE.desc: Name of the tribunal where the company is registered.

GF.name: Slot charter party
GF.desc: An identification code of a participant or user that books slots (space) on a ship, more likely on a long term basis on a series of sailings. He pays for the space whether he uses it or not.

GG.name: Warehouse
GG.desc: The name of the warehouse where product is held.

GH.name: Applicant for job
GH.desc: A person who applied for a job.

GL.name: Socially insured person
GL.desc: A person who is registered in a social security scheme.

GM.name: Inventory controller
GM.desc: To specifically identify the party in charge of inventory control.

GN.name: Processor
GN.desc: Party or person who has or will apply a process.

GO.name: Goods owner
GO.desc: The party which owns the goods.

GP.name: Packer
GP.desc: Party or person who has undertaken or will undertake packing.

GQ.name: Slaughterer
GQ.desc: Party or person who has undertaken or will undertake a slaughter.

GR.name: Goods releaser
GR.desc: (3026) Party entitled to authorize release of goods from custodian.

GS.name: Consignor's representative
GS.desc: Party authorised to represent the consignor.

GT.name: Rail carrier
GT.desc: A carrier moving cargo, including containers, via rail.

I1.name: Intermediary bank 1
I1.desc: A financial institution between the ordered bank and the beneficiary's bank.

I2.name: Intermediary bank 2
I2.desc: A financial institution between the ordered bank and the beneficiary's bank.

IM.name: Importer
IM.desc: (3020) Party who makes - or on whose behalf a Customs clearing agent or other authorized person makes - an import declaration. This may include a person who has possession of the goods or to whom the goods are consigned.

IS.name: Party to receive certified inspection report
IS.desc: Party (at buyer) to receive certified inspection report.

IV.name: Invoicee
IV.desc: (3006) Party to whom an invoice is issued.

LA.name: Party designated to provide living animal care
LA.desc: Party responsible to take care of transported living animals.

LP.name: Loading party
LP.desc: Party responsible for the loading when other than carrier.

MA.name: Party for whom item is ultimately intended

MG.name: Party designated to execute re-icing
MG.desc: Party designated to execute re-icing, selected in the official list of mandatories competent for this kind of operation.

MS.name: Document/message issuer/sender
MS.desc: Issuer of a document and/or sender of a message.

MT.name: Party designated to execute sanitary procedures

NI.name: Notify party
NI.desc: (3180) Party to be notified of arrival of goods.

OA.name: Break bulk berth operator
OA.desc: Party who offers facilities for berthing of vessels, handling and storage of break bulk cargo.

OF.name: On behalf of
OF.desc: Party on behalf of which an action is executed.

OI.name: Outside inspection agency
OI.desc: Third party inspecting goods or equipment.

OR.name: Ordered bank
OR.desc: Identifies the account servicer for the ordering customer or payor.

OS.name: Original shipper
OS.desc: The original supplier of the goods.

OT.name: Outside test agency
OT.desc: Third party testing goods, equipment or services.

OV.name: Owner of means of transport
OV.desc: (3126) Party owning the means of transport. No synonym of carrier = CA.

OY.name: Ordering customer
OY.desc: Identifies the originator of the instruction.

PA.name: Party to receive inspection report
PA.desc: Party to whom the inspection report should be sent.

PB.name: Paying financial institution
PB.desc: Financial institution designated to make payment.

PC.name: Actual purchaser's customer
PC.desc: Party the purchaser within the actual message is selling the ordered goods or services to.

PE.name: Payee
PE.desc: Identifies the credit party when other than the beneficiary.

PF.name: Party to receive freight bill
PF.desc: Party to whom the freight bill should be sent.

PG.name: Prime contractor
PG.desc: Party responsible for the whole project if other than the buyer.

PJ.name: Party to receive correspondence
PJ.desc: Second party designated by a first party to receive certain correspondence in lieu of it being mailed directly to this first party.

PL.name: Payor
PL.desc: Identifies the debit party when other than the ordering customer (for banking purposes).

PM.name: Party to receive paper memo of invoice
PM.desc: Party being informed about invoice issue (via paper).

PO.name: Ordering party
PO.desc: To be used only if ordering party and buyer are not identical.

PS.name: Payer's company name/ID (Check, Draft or Wire)

PW.name: Despatch party
PW.desc: (3282) Party where goods are collected or taken over by the carrier (i.e. if other than consignor).

PY.name: Checking party
PY.desc: Party or contact designated on behalf of carrier or his agent to establish the actual figures for quantities, weight, volume and/or (cube) measurements of goods or containers which are to appear in the transport contract and on which charges will be based.

PZ.name: Party to print some document
PZ.desc: The party that is to print a specific document.

RA.name: Central bank or regulatory authority
RA.desc: Identifies central bank or regulatory authority which must be informed of certain aspects of a message.

RB.name: Receiving financial institution
RB.desc: Financial institution designated to receive payment.

RE.name: Party to receive commercial invoice remittance
RE.desc: Party to whom payment for a commercial invoice or bill should be remitted.

RF.name: Received from
RF.desc: Name of a person or department which actually delivers the goods.

RH.name: Seller's financial institution
RH.desc: Financial institution designated by seller to receive payment. RDFI (ACH transfers).

RI.name: Reinsurance intermediary/broker
RI.desc: Intermediary party between ceding company and reinsurance.

RL.name: Reporting carrier (Customs)
RL.desc: Party who makes the cargo report to Customs.

RM.name: Reporting carrier's nominated agent/representative (Customs)
RM.desc: Agent who formally makes a cargo report to Customs on behalf of the carrier.

RP.name: Routing party
RP.desc: Party responsible for the selection of the carrier(s).

RS.name: Party to receive statement of account
RS.desc: Party to whom the statement of account should be sent.

RV.name: Receiver of cheque
RV.desc: Identifies the party which is to receive the actual cheque, when different from the receiver of funds.

RW.name: Issuer of waybill
RW.desc: Party issuing the contract (waybill) for carriage.

SE.name: Seller
SE.desc: (3346) Party selling merchandise to a buyer.

SF.name: Ship from
SF.desc: Identification of the party from where goods will be or have been shipped.

SO.name: Sold to if different than bill to

SR.name: Seller's agent/representative
SR.desc: (3254) Party representing the seller for the purpose of the trade transaction.

ST.name: Ship to
ST.desc: Identification of the party to where goods will be or have been shipped.

SU.name: Supplier
SU.desc: (3280) Party which manufactures or otherwise has possession of goods, and consigns or makes them available in trade.

SX.name: Surety for additions
SX.desc: Natural of legal person (generally a bank of insurance company) who accepts responsibility in due legal form for the financial guarantee to Customs of the payment of additional duties or fees that become due against a particular shipment, which have not previously been covered by surety.

SY.name: Surety
SY.desc: Natural or legal person (generally a bank or insurance company) who accepts responsibility in due legal form for the financial consequences of non-fulfilment of another's obligations to the Customs (CCC).

SZ.name: Surety for antidumping/countervailing duty
SZ.desc: Natural or legal person that has been contracted by the importer to guarantee to Customs the payment of antidumping and/or countervailing duties that become due against a particular shipment.

TCP.name: Transit charge payer
TCP.desc: Party, other than the ordering party, which has to pay the charges concerning the transit operations.

TD.name: Party to receive technical documentation
TD.desc: Party to whom technical documentation should be sent.

TR.name: Terminal operator
TR.desc: A party which handles the loading and unloading of marine vessels.

TS.name: Party to receive certified test results
TS.desc: Party to whom the certified test results should be sent.

UC.name: Ultimate consignee
UC.desc: Party who has been designated on the invoice or packing list as the final recipient of the stated merchandise.

UHP.name: Unexpected handling party
UHP.desc: Party authorized (during a voyage) to apply unexpected handling procedures or party having applied these procedures.

WD.name: Warehouse depositor
WD.desc: (3004) Party depositing goods in a warehouse.

WH.name: Warehouse keeper
WH.desc: (3022) Party taking responsibility for goods entered into a warehouse.

WPA.name: Weighting party
WPA.desc: Party designated (legally accepted) to ascertain the weight.

WS.name: Wholesaler
WS.desc: Seller of articles, often in large quantities, to be retailed by others.

ZZZ.name: Mutually defined
ZZZ.desc: Party specification mutually agreed between interchanging parties.
